ENGLISH: Lately our capital has seen crime-fighting actions by a lone individual in feline dress styling himself ‘The Catman’, repelling sharks as he goes.
GERMAN: Seit neustem existiert in unserer Hauptstadt ein einsamer Verbrechensbekämpfer in einem Katzenkostüm der sich selbst 'Der Katzenman' nennt, und woimmer er ist Haie zurücktreibt.

ENGLISH: Masked vigilante strikes!
GERMAN: Maskierter Ordnungshüter schlägt zu!

ENGLISH: Yesterday Carl Friedrich Gauss, the famous German mathematician, died. Mathematicians will remember him for centuries. He named mathematics ‘the queen of sciences.
GERMAN: Gestern ist der bedeutende deutsche Mathematiker Carl Friedrich Gauss gestorben. Mathematiker in aller Welt werden sich für Jahrhunderte an ihn zurückerinnern. Er nannte die Mathematik 'Königin der Wissenschaften'

ENGLISH: Gauss Dies
GERMAN: Gauss gestorben

ENGLISH: In the year of 1848 the first responsible government in British North America is established in the colony of Nova Scotia and is led by James Uniacke and Joseph Howe.
GERMAN: Im Jahre 1848 wurde die erste verantwortungsvolle britische Regierung Nord Amerikas in der Kolonie von Nova Scotia gegründet, welche von James Uniacke und Joseph Howe geführt wird.

ENGLISH: Responsible Government!
GERMAN: Verantwortungsvolle Regierung!

ENGLISH: A recent article in a $TAG_0_0_ADJ$ newspaper startled their nation! A detailed analysis of their chilly relations with $TAG_0_1$ and a comparison of their relative military strengths led the editor to the conclusion that both countries might soon find themselves in a state of war, and when that day comes, $TAG_0_0$’s very existence might be threatened. ENGLISH: Reports of rumours are coming in from our correspondent in $TAG_0_0$. An unnamed source informs that a series of meetings involving top military officers have taken place in their capital in the last few months. The top theme of these meetings involves a possible fictitious scenario where war is declared, and our military invades them. Measures of counterattack and, if needed, even guerrilla warfare methods were discussed. Apparently, the top command of the $TAG_0_0_ADJ$ army is preparing for the worst. ENGLISH: Prejudice and hatred reign in $TAG_0_0$. ENGLISH: Delayed enemy in $STRING_0_3$
GERMAN: Feind in $STRING_0_3$ aufgehalten

ENGLISH: Moral victory in $STRING_0_3$
GERMAN: Moralischer Sieg in $STRING_0_3$

ENGLISH: On $DATE_LONG_0$ our incompetent high command shockingly sent $VALUE_INT_0_4$ of our brave soldiers to their deaths in $STRING_0_3$ against the forces of $TAG_0_2$. Our $VALUE_INT_0_3$ fine troops faced $VALUE_INT1$ $TAG_0_2_ADJ$ soldiers, and despite poor leadership and the enemy’s underhanded tactics managed to inflict $VALUE_INT_0_2$ casualties upon them. This paper expresses grave concerns over the direction the high command is taking this war, and strongly urges the Government to take steps to correct it before it is too late!
GERMAN: Am $DATE_LONG_0$ sendete unser unfähiges Oberkommando schockierenderweise $VALUE_INT_0_4$ unserer tapferen Soldaten in $STRING_0_3$ gegen die Truppen von $TAG_0_2$ in den Tod. $VALUE_INT_0_3$ feine Soldaten stellten sich $VALUE_INT1$ $TAG_0_2_ADJ$ Mann und konnten trotz schlechter Führung und der Hinterlist des Gegners $VALUE_INT_0_2$ Opfer mit sich nehmen. Wir bringen unsere große Sorge über die Richtung des Oberkommandos in diesem Krieg zum Ausdruck und fordern die Regierung dazu auf, das Ruder herumzureißen, bevor es zu spät ist!

ENGLISH: Reports from the field tell us that on $DATE_LONG_0$, our courageous troops have made a tactical retreat from the battle against $TAG_0_3$ in $STRING_0_3$. This has been proven necessary to maximise our element of unpredictability and surprise. $VALUE_INT_0_4$ enemy soldiers have been killed by our valiant boys. Although $VALUE_INT_0_2$ of our soldiers are yet to report back for duty, it’s worth noting that many of our troops remain hidden to surprise the enemy in an ambush, showing true courage and resilience!
GERMAN: Meldungen von der Front berichten, dass unsere tapferen Truppen am $DATE_LONG_0$ einen taktischen Rückzug vom Kampf gegen $TAG_0_3$ in $STRING_0_3$ antraten. Dies erwies sich zur Maximierung unseres Überraschungselements und unserer Unberechenbarkeit als notwendig. $VALUE_INT_0_4$ feindliche Soldaten fanden durch unsere wackeren Jungs den Tod. Auch wenn $VALUE_INT_0_2$ unserer Soldaten noch vermisst werden, sollte nicht vergessen werden, dass viele unserer Truppen weiterhin im Hinterhalt auf den Feind lauern und wahre Tapferkeit und Widerstandskraft beweisen.

ENGLISH: On $DATE_LONG_0$ we lost the battle of $STRING_0_3$, losing $VALUE_INT_0_4$ men and leaving $TAG_0_2$ in control of the field.
GERMAN: Am $DATE_LONG_0$ verloren wir die Schlacht von $STRING_0_3$, $VALUE_INT_0_4$ Männer und die Kontrolle des Feldes an $TAG_0_2$.

ENGLISH: On $DATE_LONG_0$, a tactical retreat from the battle against $TAG_0_3$ has been proven necessary, in order to maximise our element of surprise! $VALUE_INT_0_2$ of our soldiers are said to be hiding for an ambush, while $VALUE_INT_0_4$ enemy troops have been killed!
GERMAN: Am $DATE_LONG_0$ erwies sich ein taktischer Rückzug vom Kampf gegen $TAG_0_3$ zur Maximierung unseres Überraschungselements als notwendig. Schätzungsweise $VALUE_INT_0_2$ unserer Soldaten verbergen sich weiterhin im Hinterhalt und $VALUE_INT_0_4$ feindliche Truppen fanden den Tod.

ENGLISH: On $DATE_LONG_0$ we lost the battle of $STRING_0_3$, losing $VALUE_INT_0_4$ men and leaving $TAG_0_2$ in control of the field.
GERMAN: Am $DATE_LONG_0$ verloren wir die Schlacht von $STRING_0_3$, $VALUE_INT_0_4$ Männer und die Kontrolle des Feldes an $TAG_0_2$.

ENGLISH: On $DATE_LONG_0$, a tactical retreat has been conducted from the battle against $TAG_0_3$. It is thought $VALUE_INT_0_2$ of our troops are in hiding, preparing for an ambush!
GERMAN: Am $DATE_LONG_0$ kam es zum taktischen Rückzug vom Kampf gegen $TAG_0_3$. Schätzungsweise $VALUE_INT_0_2$ unserer Soldaten verbergen sich weiterhin im Hinterhalt und lauern auf den Feind.

ENGLISH: MILITARY BLUNDER LEADS TO DISASTER IN $STRING_0_3$!
GERMAN: MILITÄRISCHER PATZER FÜHRT ZU DESASTER IN $STRING_0_3$!

ENGLISH: Defeat in $STRING_0_3$
GERMAN: Niederlage in $STRING_0_3$

ENGLISH: Disaster in $STRING_0_3$
GERMAN: Desaster in $STRING_0_3$

ENGLISH: On $DATE_LONG_0$ our unrivalled army was, once again, victorious in the battle of $STRING_0_3$! $VALUE_INT_0_1$ of our men bravely gave $VALUE_INT_0_3$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ troops a sound seeing to, and while $VALUE_INT_0_2$ of our fearless troops lost their lives, over $VALUE_INT_0_4$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ scoundrels were killed and the field was left in our hands. After a defeat like this, $TAG_0_3$ surely must soon seek peace terms!
GERMAN: Am $DATE_LONG_0$ war unsere ungeschlagene Armee in der Schlacht von $STRING_0_3$ erneut siegreich! $VALUE_INT_0_1$ unserer tapferen Männer gaben $VALUE_INT_0_3$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ Truppen Saures und auch wenn $VALUE_INT_0_2$ unserer tapferen Mannen ihr Leben ließen, wurden mehr als $VALUE_INT_0_4$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ Schurken getötet. Nach einer solchen Niederlage, wird $TAG_0_3$ sicherlich um Frieden ersuchen!

ENGLISH: On $DATE_LONG_0$ we defeated $VALUE_INT_0_3$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ troops in $STRING_0_3$, at the cost of $VALUE_INT_0_2$ lives lost.
GERMAN: Am $DATE_LONG_0$ besiegten wir $VALUE_INT_0_3$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ Truppen in $STRING_0_3$, zum Preis von $VALUE_INT_0_2$ Leben.

ENGLISH: On $DATE_LONG_0$ we defeated $VALUE_INT_0_3$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ troops in $STRING_0_3$.
GERMAN: Am $DATE_LONG_0$ besiegten wir $VALUE_INT_0_3$ $TAG_0_3_ADJ$ Truppen in $STRING_0_3$.

ENGLISH: GLORIOUS VICTORY IN $STRING_0_3$!
GERMAN: GLORREICHER SIEG IN $STRING_0_3$!

ENGLISH: Victory in $STRING_0_3$!
GERMAN: Sieg in $STRING_0_3$!

ENGLISH: Victory!
GERMAN: Sieg!

ENGLISH: Workers of the world, unite!’ Once more our rallying cry has proven fitting for such a victorious revolution. The corrupt powers of capitalism cannot stop the desire of the proletariat for a better future. We have received joyous news from our comrades in $TAG_0_0$, who managed to rise in rebellion against the crooks and thieves that mistreated and exploited the common folk. They seized the governmental powers, taking it back where it belongs: the hands of the people, represented by the people’s committee: $STRING_0_0$!
GERMAN: Unser Aufruf 'Proletarier aller Länder, vereinigt Euch!' zeigt sich erneut mehr als passend für eine so siegreiche Revolution. Die korrupten Machenschaften des Kapitalismus können den Wunsch des Proletariats auf eine bessere Zukunft nicht ersticken. Wir erhielten frohe Kunde von unseren Genossen in $TAG_0_0$, deren Rebellion gegen die Gauner und Diebe, die das Volk misshandeln und ausnutzen, sich im Aufwind befindet. Sie haben die Regierungsaufgaben dorthin übertragen, wo sie hingehören: in die Hand des Volkes, repräsentiert durch ein Volkskomitee: $STRING_0_0$!

ENGLISH: Workers of the world, unite!’ This rallying cry can be heard today throughout $TAG_0_0$, where our communist comrades have been victorious in overthrowing the government and establishing the one and true people’s party: $STRING_0_0$!
GERMAN: Der Aufruf 'Proletarier aller Länder, vereinigt Euch!' erschallt heute in ganz $TAG_0_0$, wo unsere kommunistischen Genossen die Regierung erfolgreich stürzten und die einzig wahre Volkspartei etablierten: $STRING_0_0$!

ENGLISH: Workers of the world, unite!’ This rallying cry can be heard today throughout $TAG_0_0$, where our comrades have been victorious in overthrowing the corrupt capitalist crooks!
GERMAN: Der Aufruf 'Proletarier aller Länder, vereinigt Euch!' erschallt heute in ganz $TAG_0_0$, wo unsere Genossen die korrupten, kapitalistischen Gauner erfolgreich stürzten!

ENGLISH: COMMUNISM TRIUMPHS IN $TAG_0_0_UPPER$!
GERMAN: KOMMUNISMUS TRIUMPHIERT IN $TAG_0_0_UPPER$!

ENGLISH: COMMUNISM IN $TAG_0_0_UPPER$!
GERMAN: KOMMUNISMUS IN $TAG_0_0_UPPER$!

ENGLISH: REVOLUTION!
GERMAN: REVOLUTION!

ENGLISH: It is peace for our time’, great powers announce, emerging from the summit negotiations with a diplomatic resolution to the brewing international crisis, which many claimed might have plunged them into war if a compromise was not reached. ‘We declare there is no desire between our peoples to go to war against one another’, the competing sides declared, though careful observers took notice that one side might be perceived as the victor, leaving the other with bitter aftertaste of concessions and loss of prestige, threatening the longevity of the signed agreement.
GERMAN: Die Großmächte verkünden 'Frieden in unserer Zeit', nachdem sie in Gipfeltreffen eine diplomatische Lösung im beginnenden internationalen Konflikt fanden, der nach Meinung vieler ohne Kompromisse zu einem Krieg geführt hätte. 'Wir erklären, dass zwischen unseren Völkern keine Kriegsabsicht besteht', äußerten beide Seiten. Wachsame Beobachter deuten an, dass eine Seite durchaus als Sieger hervorging, während die andere bittere Zugeständnisse und heftigen Prestigeverlust hinnehmen musste, was die Langlebigkeit des unterzeichneten Abkommens in Frage stellt.

ENGLISH: There is widespread relief following the news that a peaceful solution has been arrived at in $STRING_0_0$, recently a diplomatic hot spot. <CrisisWinner++++++> has managed to increase their influence after securing the backing of the Great Powers. An International Conference successfully brought the crisis to an end following weeks of diplomatic manoeuvres. War has been averted for the time being, although there is not universal satisfaction with the outcome, and it remains to be seen whether another power will challenge <CrisisWinner++++++> in the future.
GERMAN: Weltweite Erleichterung folgt auf die Nachricht, dass eine friedliche Lösung im diplomatischen Hexenkessel $STRING_0_0$ gefunden wurde. <CrisisWinner++++++> konnte mit dem Rückhalt der Großmächte seinen Einfluss erhöhen. Eine internationale Konferenz, nach Wochen voll diplomatischer Manöver, beendete den Konflikt erfolgreich. Für den Augenblick wurde ein Krieg verhindert, auch wenn nicht alle mit dem Ergebnis zufrieden sind. Es bleibt abzuwarten, ob eine andere Macht <CrisisWinner++++++> in der Zukunft herausfordern wird.

ENGLISH: It is peace for our time’, great powers announce, emerging from the summit negotiations with a diplomatic resolution to the brewing international crisis, which many claimed might have plunged them into the dreaded state of war if a compromise was not reached.
GERMAN: Die Großmächte verkünden 'Frieden in unserer Zeit', nachdem sie in Gipfeltreffen eine diplomatische Lösung im beginnenden internationalen Konflikt fanden, der nach Meinung vieler ohne Kompromisse zu einem Krieg geführt hätte.

ENGLISH: The international crisis in $STRING_0_0$ has reached a peaceful solution following a diplomatic conference of the Great Powers. <CrisisWinner++++++> has been able to increase their influence, without resorting to war. It remains to be seen whether this peace will last.
GERMAN: Der internationale Konflikt in $STRING_0_0$ fand nach einer diplomatischen Konferenz der Großmächte eine friedliche Lösung. <CrisisWinner++++++> konnte seinen Einfluss erhöhen, ohne zu Kriegsmitteln greifen zu müssen. Es bleibt abzuwarten, ob der Frieden halten wird.

ENGLISH: It is peace for our time’, great powers announce, emerging from the summit negotiations with a diplomatic resolution to the brewing international crisis, averting the possibility of war.
GERMAN: Die Großmächte verkünden 'Frieden in unserer Zeit', nachdem sie in Gipfeltreffen eine diplomatische Lösung im beginnenden internationalen Konflikt fanden und Krieg vermeideten.

ENGLISH: War has been averted as the crisis in $STRING_0_0$ has been resolved following a conference of the Great Powers. <CrisisWinner++++++> has successfully increased their influence
GERMAN: Ein Konflikt in $STRING_0_0$ wurde nach einer Konferenz der Großmächte gelöst und Krieg verhindert. <CrisisWinner++++++> konnte erfolgreich seinen Einfluss erhöhen.

ENGLISH: CRISIS AVERTED!
GERMAN: KONFLIKT VERHINDERT!

ENGLISH: Tensions Recede
GERMAN: Spannungen nehmen ab

ENGLISH: Whether there still remains any hope to resolve the matter peacefully, no one is able to tell at this point, as great powers of the world lock themselves in the power struggle of the commencing international crisis. A diplomatic settlement of the matter might still remain within reach, but the clock on reaching one quickly runs out, and as the belligerent participants delay the resolution by drawing lines in sand and flexing their muscles in politics of attrition and coercion to reduce or avoid concessions, they might soon find themselves in the dreaded state of war.
GERMAN: Niemand kann sagen, ob noch Hoffnung besteht, diese Angelegenheit friedlich zu lösen, nun da die Großmächte der Welt im Machtkampf des beginnenden, internationalen Konflikts Position beziehen. Ein diplomatisches Abkommen könnte noch machbar sein, doch die Zeit läuft davon, und die aggressiven Teilnehmer verzögern eine Lösung mit Muskelspielen und Machtspielen in der Politik der Zermürbung und machen Druck, um Zugeständnisse zu verhindern. Sie könnten sich schon bald im gefürchteten Kriegszustand wiederfinden.

ENGLISH: Following months of increasing pressure, tensions in $STRING_0_0$ have reached a point where we have an international crisis on our hands. The Great Powers are trying to find a peaceful solution to prevent further escalation, but there are also some who seek to increase their influence. Frantic diplomatic activity is taking place as the Great Powers clamour for influence. If a resolution is not found, and as those on the side-lines take sides in the dispute, an incident in $STRING_0_0$ has the potential to develop into a general war.
GERMAN: Nach Monaten zunehmendem Drucks haben die Spannungen in $STRING_0_0$ einen Punkt erreicht, der zu einem handfesten internationalen Konflikt wird. Die Großmächte suchen nach einer friedlichen Lösung, um eine weitere Eskalation zu verhindern, doch es gibt auch einige, die ihren Einfluß ausdehnen wollen. Panische diplomatische Handlungen finden statt, während die Großmächte mehr Einfluss fordern. Wenn keine Lösung gefunden wird, während zunehmend Außenstehende im Disput Seiten einnehmen, kann ein Vorfall in $STRING_0_0$ durchaus einen Krieg auslösen.

ENGLISH: Great powers of the world lock themselves in a power struggle. A diplomatic settlement of the matter might still remain within reach, but the clock on reaching one quickly runs out, as the belligerent parties delay the resolution by drawing lines in sand and flexing their muscles.
GERMAN: Die Großmächte der Welt beziehen in einem Machtkampf Position. Ein diplomatisches Abkommen könnte noch machbar sein, doch die Zeit läuft davon, und die aggressiven Teilnehmer verzögern eine Lösung mit Muskelspielen und Machtspielen in der Politik.

ENGLISH: Great Powers are vying for influence in $STRING_0_0$, and tensions have risen dramatically in the region. A peaceful solution is being sought by the Great Powers in a bid to avoid any further escalation, but it remains to be seen whether conflict can be avoided.
GERMAN: Großmächte wetteifern um Einfluss in $STRING_0_0$ und die Spannungen sind in der Region dramatisch angestiegen. Um jede weitere Eskalation zu vermeiden, suchen die Großmächte nach einer friedlichen Lösung, doch noch ist nicht sicher, ob ein Konflikt vermieden werden kann.

ENGLISH: Great powers of the world lock themselves in a power struggle. A diplomatic settlement of the matter might still remain within reach, but the clock on reaching one quickly runs out.
GERMAN: Die Großmächte der Welt beziehen in einem Machtkampf Position. Ein diplomatisches Abkommen könnte noch machbar sein, doch die Zeit läuft davon.

ENGLISH: Tensions in $STRING_0_0$ have developed into a major crisis, as the Great Powers attempt to gain influence in the region. Frantic diplomatic activity is underway to try and avert war.
GERMAN: Spannungen in $STRING_0_0$ ufern in Konflikt aus, während Großmächte in der Region mehr Einfluss anstreben. Panische diplomatische Aktivitäten versuchen, einen Krieg zu verhindern.

ENGLISH: Crisis set in motion!
GERMAN: Konflikt in Gang gesetzt!

ENGLISH: Tensions Rise!
GERMAN: Spannungen nehmen zu!

ENGLISH: Prof. Hitchcock reports fossil tracks of birds discovered near the Connecticut river in Massachusetts. Some of the foot marks indicate that they were made by some enormous species of bird…
GERMAN: Prof. Hitchcock meldet Entdeckung von Fossilienspuren von Vögeln nahe des Connecticut-Flusses, Massachusetts. Einige Spuren deuten auf riesige Vogelart hin…

ENGLISH: In honour of Dr Engelhardt, original discoverer of the remains, Dr von Meyer named a new giant saurian as Plateosaurus engelhardti. It seems to be related to Iguanodon and Megalosaurus.
GERMAN: Zu Ehren des Entdeckers Dr. Engelhardt nannte Dr. von Meyer einen neuen riesigen Saurier 'Plateosaurus engelhardti'. Er scheint mit Iguanodon und Megalosaurus verwandt zu sein.

ENGLISH: This unusual saurian has teeth in its sockets instead of having them fused to the jaw like modern reptiles, say Dr Riley and Dr Stutchbury, the describers of this lizard.
GERMAN: Dieser ungewöhnliche Saurier besaß Zähne in Zahnhöhlen, nicht wie moderne Reptilien direkt mit dem Kiefer verbundene, wie Dr. Rilez und Dr. Stutchbury, Entdecker der Eidechse, sagen.

ENGLISH: Dr Eudes-Deslongchamps reports on a new saurian known from vertebrae, ribs and limbs. He thinks this animal is related to the Megalosaurus.
GERMAN: Dr. Eudes-Deslongchamps meldet aufgrund von Wirbel-, Rippen- und Gliedmaßen-Funden einen neuen Saurier. Er glaubt, das Tier ist mit dem Megalosaurus verwandt.

ENGLISH: Ornithichnology
GERMAN: Ornithichnologie

ENGLISH: Plateosaurus
GERMAN: Plateosaurus

ENGLISH: Thecodontosaurus
GERMAN: Thecodontosaurus

ENGLISH: Poekilopleuron
GERMAN: Poekilopleuron

ENGLISH: Dinosauria is the name Prof. Owen proposed for the tribe of Saurians that include Megalosaurus, Hylaeosaurus and Iguanodon. These dinosaurians are remarkable for their large size.
GERMAN: Prof. Owen schlug für die Sauriergattung, der Megalosaurus, Hylaeosaurus und Iguanodon angehören, den Namen Dinosauria vor. Ihre Größe ist bemerkenswert.

ENGLISH: A new giant fossil sea-dwelling reptilian was discovered. Prof. Owen named it Cetiosaurus, which means ‘whale lizard’.
GERMAN: Neue Entdeckung eines riesigen, aquatischen Reptil-Fossils. Prof. Owen nannte es Cetiosaurus, was “Wal-Echse” bedeutet.

ENGLISH: A single heart shaped tooth was discovered in Wiltshire, England. After analysing it Prof. Owen decided to give it the name of Cardiodon.
GERMAN: Ein einzelner, herzförmiger Zahn wurde in Wiltshire, England entdeckt. Prof. Owen entschloss sich nach seiner Analyse, ihn Cardiodon zu taufen.

ENGLISH: After some jaws of the Iguanodon were discovered, Dr Mantell assumed his error in a previously assigned portion of a jaw to this beast and now described it as a separate species.
GERMAN: Nach dem Fund einiger Kieferknochen des Iguanodons vermutete Dr. Mantell einen Fehler in seiner vorherigen Zuordnung eines Kiefers zu diesem Biest und beschreibt ihn nun als separate Spezies.

ENGLISH: Biologist Richard Owen creates first life-size concrete sculptures of extinct gigantic reptiles, fossils of which were discovered in South Africa and New Zealand. He calls them ‘Dinosauria’.
GERMAN: Biologe Richard Owen erstellt erste lebensgroße Skulpturen von ausgestorbenen, gigantischen Reptilien, deren Fossilien in Südafrika und Neuseeland entdeckt wurden. Er nennt sie 'Dinosauria'.

ENGLISH: Dinosauria
GERMAN: Dinosauria

ENGLISH: Cetiosaurus
GERMAN: Cetiosaurus

ENGLISH: Cardiodon
GERMAN: Cardiodon

ENGLISH: Regnosaurus
GERMAN: Regnosaurus

ENGLISH: Dinosauria?
GERMAN: Dinosauria?

ENGLISH: Dr Leidy has described two new dinosaurians from America, named Trachodon and Deinodon. Other indeterminate lacertians named Palaeoscincus and Troodon were also discovered.
GERMAN: Dr. Leidy beschrieb zwei neue Dinosaurier aus Amerika, namens Trachodon und Deinodon. Weitere untergeordnete Echsen namens Palaeoscincus und Troodon wurden ebenfalls entdeckt.

ENGLISH: This new dinosaurian appears to be related to the Iguanodon. Dr Leidy suspects the animal sustained itself in a bipedal erect posture.
GERMAN: Dieser neue Dinosaurier scheint mit dem Iguanodon verwandt zu sein. Dr. Leidy vermutet bei dem Tier einen aufrechten Gang auf zwei Beinen.

ENGLISH: Dinosaurians in America
GERMAN: Dinosaurier in Amerika

ENGLISH: Hadrosaurus
GERMAN: Hadrosaurus

ENGLISH: A new species of saurian was found and was named Compsognathus. Dr Wagner says the lizard reminds us somewhat of birds, but such relationship cannot be justified.
GERMAN: Neue Saurierspezies entdeckt und Compsognathus getauft. Dr. Wagner sagt, die Echse erinnere fern an Vögel, doch ein solcher Bezug sei nicht erwiesen.

ENGLISH: A finely fossilized feather was discovered, and Dr von Meyer named it Archaeopteryx which means ancient feather or wing.
GERMAN: Ein perfektes Fossil einer Feder wurde entdeckt und Dr. Wagner taufte sie Archaeopteryx, was für eine altertümliche Feder oder einen Flügel steht.

ENGLISH: After Dr Johnston named some saurian teeth as Astrodon, Dr Leidy now completes the name and gives it a specific epithet in his honour.
GERMAN: Nachdem Dr. Johnston einige Saurierzähne als Astrodon bezeichnete, vollendet Dr. Leidy nun den Namen zu dessen Ehren mit diesem spezifischen Beinamen.

ENGLISH: Professor Cope announces the discovery of a terrifying rapacious gigantic dinosaur related to Megalosaurus and Dinodon.
GERMAN: Professor Cope verkündet die Entdeckung eines furchterregenden, räuberischen, riesigen Dinosauriers, der mit Megalosaurus und Dinodon verwandt ist.

ENGLISH: E.D. Cope reports on a new enaliosaur related to the Plesiosaurus, but with a much longer tail.
GERMAN: E.D. Cope meldet einen neuen Enaliosaurus, der mit dem Plesiosaurus verwandt ist, aber einen viel längeren Schwanz hat.

ENGLISH: Archaeopteryx fossils discovered in Bavaria. Described as ‘the first bird’ and ‘the missing link between dinosaurs and birds’, it constitutes the proof Darwin needed to validate his theory.
GERMAN: Archaeopteryx-Fossilien in Bayern gefunden. Die 'ersten Vögel' bilden 'fehlende Verbindung zwischen Dinosauriern und Vögeln' und liefern den Beweis, den Darwin für seine Theorie brauchte.

ENGLISH: Mr. Matheron reports on vertebrae and giant egg fragments from a likely aquatic saurian he names Hypselosaurus from the Fuveau basin.
GERMAN: Mr. Matheron meldet Funde von Wirbelknochen und gigantischen Eifragmenten eines womöglich aquatischen Sauriers im Fuveau-Becken, den er Hypselosaurus taufte.

ENGLISH: Compsognathus
GERMAN: Compsognathus

ENGLISH: Archaeopteryx
GERMAN: Archaeopteryx

ENGLISH: johnstoni, Astrodon johnstoni!
GERMAN: johnstoni, Astrodon johnstoni!

ENGLISH: Laelaps
GERMAN: Laelaps

ENGLISH: Elasmosaurus
GERMAN: Elasmosaurus

ENGLISH: Archaeopteryx
GERMAN: Archaeopteryx

ENGLISH: Hypselosaurus
GERMAN: Hypselosaurus

ENGLISH: After Dr Marsh reported openly to the public Dr Cope’s error in placing Elasmosaurus’ head in its tail they have become sworn enemies and a ferocious scientific competition has now started.
GERMAN: Dr. Marshs Veröfentlichung, dass Dr. Cope den Kopf des Elasmosaurus irrtümlich am Schwanzende anbrachte, machte sie zu Erzrivalen und ein erbitterter wissenschaftl. Wettstreit hat begonnen.

ENGLISH: In their boldest excursion to date, professor Marsh and his party cross the Sioux territory to reach the most promising excavation sites in the White River Badlands in South Dakota.
GERMAN: Bei der bislang gewagtesten Exkursion dringen Prof. Marsh und sein Team in Gebiet der Sioux vor, um vielversprechende Ausgrabungsorte in den White River Badlands, South Dakota, zu erreichen.

ENGLISH: O.C. Marsh and his group are reported to have barely escaped an Indian war party raid against their camp. Their hasty retreat didn’t hinder securing of nearly two tonnes of excavated bones.
GERMAN: Laut Meldungen entkamen O.C. Marsh und seine Gruppe nur knapp einem indianischen Raubzug gegen ihr Lager. Trotz übereilter Flucht konnten fast 2 Tonnen ausgegrabener Knochen gesichert werden.

ENGLISH: Professor Cope reports from the San Juan River area, where he discovered dozens of new vertebrate species after departing from the geological survey expedition he had been attached to.
GERMAN: Prof. Cope berichtet nach seiner Rückkehr von der geologischen Expedition, an der er teilgenommen hatte, von der Entdeckung dutzender, neuer Wirbeltierarten in der Gegend des San Juan-Flusses.

ENGLISH: O.C. Marsh discloses two of his agents uncovered bones as thick and as long as logs at the excavation in Como Bluff, Wyoming. Diplodocus and Allosaurus among many newly discovered species.
GERMAN: O.C. Marsh meldet die Ausgrabung von Knochen, so dick und lang wie Baumstämme, durch zwei Mitarbeiter in Como Bluff, Wyoming. Neben Diplodocus und Allosaurus auch viele neue Arten.

ENGLISH: New fossils of the primitive bird Archaeopteryx show shocking reptilian features as claws and teeth. Evolutionists are making a big deal of these findings and call it a missing link.
GERMAN: Neue Fossilien des primitiven Vogels Archaeopteryx zeigen schockierende Reptilienmerkmale wie Klauen und Zähne. Evolutionisten reißen sich um die Entdeckung, sie sei ein fehlender Link.

ENGLISH: Many prominent palaeontologists are fearing for Prof. Huxley’s mental state after he proposed another ridiculous evolutionary claim: he says reptilian dinosaurians and birds are related!
GERMAN: Viele bekannte Paläontologen fürchten um Prof. Huxleys Geisteszustand, nachdem er eine weitere lächerliche Evolutionstheorie vortrug: er sagt, reptilische Dinosaurier und Vögel sind verwandt!

ENGLISH: A new kind of weird and enormous turtle was discovered in the North American West. Prof. Marsh called it Stegosaurus, meaning roofed lizard.
GERMAN: Eine neue Art einer merkwürdigen, gigantischen Schildkröte wurde im Westen Nordamerikas entdeckt. Prof. Marsh nennt sie Stegosaurus, was soviel wie überdachte Eidechse heisst.

ENGLISH: A breakthrough discovery by O.C. Marsh. Airborne creatures’ fossils of which were found in North America, unlike any other species of pterosaurian, seem to have lacked teeth entirely.
GERMAN: Bahnbrechende Entdeckung von O.C. Marsh. In Nordamerika gefundene Fossilien von fliegenden Kreaturen hatten, im Gegensatz zu anderen Pterosaurus-Arten, keine Zähne.

ENGLISH: Buried in a coal formation in Wyoming lied ‘the wreck of one of the princes among giants’, as E.D. Cope described of what was undoubtedly the largest land animal known to date.
GERMAN: Laut E.D. Cope liegt in einer Kohleformation in Wyoming 'das Wrack eines Prinzen unter den Giganten', zweifelsohne das bislang größte, entdeckte Landtier.

ENGLISH: Marsh, Cope and Leidy move their excavation work to the Bridger Basin area in Wyoming. Their camps mere miles apart, top three palaeontologists are reported to never speak with one another.
GERMAN: Marsh, Cope und Leidy verlagern Ausgrabungsarbeiten nach Bridger Basin, Wyoming. Trotz benachbarter Lager wechseln die drei führenden Paläontologen kein Wort miteinander.

ENGLISH: Professor Marsh is elated over his election to the prestigious National Academy of Sciences. Professor Cope is reported to have been the only member of the academy to cast a ‘no’ vote.
GERMAN: Professor Marsh erfreut über seine Wahl in anerkannte Nationale Akademie der Wissenschaften. Laut Meldungen votierte Professor Cope als einziges Akademiemitglied mit 'Nein'.

ENGLISH: Professor Marsh announces discovery of Hesperornis, a tall and almost wingless aquatic volucrine propelling with powerful hind legs and using his toothed beak to snatch underwater prey.
GERMAN: Professor Marsh verkündet Entdeckung des Hesperornis, eine große, fast flügellose Seekreatur, mit kraftvollen Hinterläufen und einem Schnabel mit Zähnen, für die Beutejagd unter Wasser.

ENGLISH: WAR!
GERMAN: KRIEG!

ENGLISH: Marsh among the Sioux
GERMAN: Marsh bei den Sioux

ENGLISH: Marsh’s camp raided!
GERMAN: Überfall auf Marshs Lager!

ENGLISH: Vertebrate galore
GERMAN: Wirbeltiere im Überfluss

ENGLISH: Como Bluff
GERMAN: Como Bluff

ENGLISH: More on Archaeopteryx
GERMAN: Mehr zum Archaeopteryx

ENGLISH: Prof. Huxley’s Insanity!
GERMAN: Prof. Huxleys Wahnsinn!

ENGLISH: Stegosaurus
GERMAN: Stegosaurus

ENGLISH: Pteranodon
GERMAN: Pteranodon

ENGLISH: Agathaumas
GERMAN: Agathaumas

ENGLISH: Bridger Basin works
GERMAN: Arbeiten in Bridger Basin

ENGLISH: Vote of no confidence
GERMAN: Misstrauensvotum

ENGLISH: Hesperornis
GERMAN: Hesperornis

ENGLISH: Dug up and assembled by palaeontologist O.C. Marsh, to the untrained eye, Brontosaurus looks suspiciously similar to the already known Apatosaurus. His skull is completely different, though.
GERMAN: Der von Paläontologe O.C. Marsh ausgegrabene und zusammengesetzte Brontosaurus sieht dem bekannten Apatosaurus verdächtig ähnlich. Der Schädel ist jedoch komplett anders.

ENGLISH: A new kind of horned dinosaur was discovered by Prof. Marsh. This animal shows that the diversity of these great saurians is bigger than suspected.
GERMAN: Neue Art gehörnter Dinosaurier von Prof. Marsh entdeckt. Das Tier beweist, dass die Artenvielfalt dieser riesigen Saurier größer ist als angenommen.

ENGLISH: This big carnivorous dinosaur surely did come out from some nightmare. The skull with its big teeth is terrifying, Prof. Marsh reports.
GERMAN: Dieser große, fleischfressende Dinosaurier entsprang sicher einem Albtraum. Der Schädel mit seinen riesigen Zähnen ist angsteinflößend, sagt Prof. Marsh.

ENGLISH: The discovery of ankylosed (fused) metatarsal bones of a dinosaur called Ceratosaurus brings birds and dinosaurs closer together, O.C. Marsh says.
GERMAN: Die Entdeckung ankylosierter (verschmolzener) Mittelfußknochen eines Dinosauriers namens Ceratosaurus bringt Vögel und Dinosaurier, laut O.C. Marsh, näher zusammen.

ENGLISH: Prof. Cope reports on a new species of dinosaur named Coelophysis, which means ‘hollow form’, a characteristic of the bones of dinosaurians.
GERMAN: Prof. Cope meldete eine neue Dinosaurierspezies namens Coelophysis, was soviel wie “hohle Form” bedeutet, ein Charaktermerkmal von Dinosaurierknochen.

ENGLISH: Prof. Cope described a new species of dinosaur named Amphicoelias fragillimus. The dimensions of the vertebra and the femur are so big that the true size of the beast should remain unknown.
GERMAN: Prof. Cope beschrieb eine neue Dinosaurierspezies namens Amphicoelias fragillimus. Wirbel- und Oberschenkelknochen sind so riesig, dass die wahre Größe dieser Bestie nicht erahnt werden kann.

ENGLISH: A big saurian, this stocky beast, described by E.D. Cope, was fortunately an herbivore, saving our minds from even bigger nightmares.
GERMAN: Dieses untersetzte Biest war laut Beschreibungen von E.D. Cope ein großer Saurier. Glücklicherweise ein Pflanzenfresser, was uns weitere Albträume erspart.

ENGLISH: E.D. Cope accuses O.C. Marsh of stealing Kovalevsky’s research into the genealogy and evolution of the horse. ‘What is new in it, isn’t correct, what is correct isn’t new’, he concludes.
GERMAN: E.D. Cope beschuldigt O.C. Marsh, Kowalevskys Forschungen zu Abstammung und Evolution der Pferde gestohlen zu haben. 'Die neuen Informationen sind falsch, die richtigen nicht neu', beklagt er.

ENGLISH: Kovalevsky was at least stricken with remorse and ended his unfortunate career by blowing out his brains. Cope still lives unrepentant’, writes O.C. Marsh in response to his rival’s attacks.
GERMAN: O.C. Marsh schrieb als Antwort auf die Attacken seiner Rivalen: 'Kowalevsky hat zumindest Gewissensbisse und beendete seine missliche Karriere mit einer Kugel. Cope lebt ohne Reue weiter.'

ENGLISH: Professor E.D. Cope publishes his life’s work-’The Vertebrata of the Tertiary Formations of the West’, a thousand pages long volume offering the most comprehensive study of the subject.
GERMAN: Prof. E.D. Cope veröffentlicht sein Lebenswerk – 'Wirbeltiere der Tertiär-Formationen im Westen', eine tausend Seiten umfassende, umfangreiche Untersuchung des Themas.

ENGLISH: Cope gathers a copious account of Marsh’s scientific errors and unethical practices by interviewing his former and present employees, to be used to ruin Marsh’s scientific reputation.
GERMAN: Cope sammelt umfangreiches Material zu Marshs wissenschaftlichen Fehlern und unethischen Praktiken durch Interviews mit früheren und aktuellen Mitarbeitern, um Marshs Reputation zu ruinieren.

ENGLISH: In the town of Bernissart an enormous quantity of these dinosaurians was discovered. Dr Dollo studied them and concluded the animal was a biped, like Dr Mantell proposed many years ago.
GERMAN: Enorme Anzahl dieser Dinosaurier in der Stadt Bernissart entdeckt. Dr. Dollo kommt in Studien zu dem Schluss, dass das Tier zweibeinig lief, wie Dr. Mantell vor einigen Jahren vermutete.

ENGLISH: After some previous classifications, Prof. Seeley has now proposed that dinosaurians should be classified according to their pelvis. Two groups then emerge, Saurischia and Ornithischia.
GERMAN: Nach vorhergehenden Klassifizierungen schlug Prof. Seeley nun vor, Dinosaurier aufgrund ihres Beckenbaus einzuordnen. Dies führt zu zwei Gruppen: Saurischia und Ornitischia.

ENGLISH: After more material has been found for Stegosaurus Prof. Marsh now thinks the animal is instead a new unusual kind of dinosaur.
GERMAN: Mit dem Fund weiteren Materials glaubt Prof. Marsh nun, dass der Stegosaurus eine neue, ungewöhnliche Dinosaurierart ist.

ENGLISH: This new group of dinosaurs exceeds by far the size of the largest land animals known. Atlantosaurus, Titanosaurus, Morosaurus, Apatosaurus and Diplodocus are some of them.
GERMAN: Diese neue Dinosaurier-Gruppe überragt alle bekannten Landtiere bei Weitem in Körpergröße. Atlantosaurus, Titanosaurus, Morosaurus, Apatosaurus und Diplodocus sind einige von ihnen.

ENGLISH: Brontosaurus?
GERMAN: Brontosaurus?

ENGLISH: Ceratops
GERMAN: Ceratops

ENGLISH: Allosaurus
GERMAN: Allosaurus

ENGLISH: Ceratosaurus
GERMAN: Ceratosaurus

ENGLISH: Coelophysis
GERMAN: Coelophysis

ENGLISH: Amphicoelias fragillimus
GERMAN: Amphicoelias fragillimus

ENGLISH: Camarasaurus
GERMAN: Camarasaurus

ENGLISH: Equine fraud?
GERMAN: Pferde-Betrug?

ENGLISH: Marsh’s repartee
GERMAN: Marsh kontert

ENGLISH: Cope’s Bible
GERMAN: Copes Bibel

ENGLISH: Cope’s Marshiana
GERMAN: Copes Marshiana

ENGLISH: Iguanodon, Iguanodon everywhere!
GERMAN: Iguanodons, überall Iguanodons!

ENGLISH: The Classification of Dinosauria
GERMAN: Die Klassifizierung von Dinosauria

ENGLISH: News on Stegosaurus
GERMAN: Neues vom Stegosaurus

ENGLISH: Sauropods
GERMAN: Sauropoden

ENGLISH: O.C. Marsh announces that the horned skull of a species he previously believed to be a large and unusual Pliocene mammal, alike to a bison, in fact belongs to a dinosaur he names Triceratops.
GERMAN: Laut O.C. Marsh gehört gehörnter Schädel, den er erst einem großen, ungewöhnlichen Säugetier, ähnlich dem Bison, zuordnete, in Wirklichkeit zu einem von ihm Triceratops getauften Dinosaurier.

ENGLISH: Outraged by the government attempt to confiscate his bone collection, Cope inspires a series of publications in the ‘New York Herald’ lambasting Marsh and his political allies in the USGS.
GERMAN: Eine Reihe von Veröffentlichungen im 'New York Herald' attackieren Marsh und seine politischen Verbündeten im USGS, nach dem Versuch der Regierung, Copes Knochensammlung zu konfiszieren.

ENGLISH: In the light of recent reports of fund mishandling and favouritism within the United States Geological Survey, Congress cuts agency’s funding, disbanding the Chief Palaeontologist’s office.
GERMAN: Nach Meldungen von Fördermittel-Missbrauch und Vetternwirtschaft in der United States Geological Survey, kürzt Kongress die Finanzierung der Behörde und schließt Büro des Chef-Paläontologen.

ENGLISH: This horned dinosaur possessed one the biggest heads of any animal known. The frill of this species is incredibly elongated, much more than in Triceratops.
GERMAN: Dieser gehörnte Dinosaurier besitzt einen der größten Köpfe unter den bekannten Tieren. Die Nackenkrause dieser Spezies ist unglaublich lang gestreckt, weit mehr als beim Triceratops.

ENGLISH: Triceratops
GERMAN: Triceratops

ENGLISH: Warfare of Scientists
GERMAN: Krieg der Forscher

ENGLISH: USGS funding cut
GERMAN: USGS-Finanzierung gekürzt

ENGLISH: Torosaurus
GERMAN: Torosaurus

ENGLISH: Cope is reported to have donated his skull to science following his death, to be compared with Marsh’s skull and resolve the conflict by measuring the intellectual prowess of both rivals.
GERMAN: Laut Berichten spendete Cope nach seinem Tod seinen Schädel der Wissenschaft, um mit Marshs Schädel durch Messung des Intellekts beider Rivalen verglichen zu werden und den Streit beizulegen.

ENGLISH: Marsh rejects Cope’s final challenge, refusing to donate his skull and exacting vengeance by condemning his rival’s skull to be forever stored in a crate at the University of Pennsylvania.
GERMAN: Marsh verweigert sich Copes letzter Herausforderung. Er spendet seinen Schädel nicht und übt Rache an seinem Rivalen, indem er Copes Schädel in einer Kiste in der Universität von Pennsylvania lagern lässt.

ENGLISH: Cope’s Skull
GERMAN: Copes Schädel

ENGLISH: Marsh’s skull
GERMAN: Marshs Schädel

ENGLISH: The new species discovered in Mongolia by Peter Kaisen is believed to have been an intelligent pack hunter. Mr. Kaisen could be heard referring to the recovered specimen as a ‘clever girl’.
GERMAN: Diese von Peter Kaisen in der Mongolei entdeckte, neue Spezies war scheinbar ein intelligenter Rudeljäger. Mr. Kaisen wird mit den Worten 'ein cleveres Mädel' zitiert.

ENGLISH: Velociraptor
GERMAN: Velociraptor

ENGLISH: Fossils of Nyasasaurus discovered near Lake Nyasa in Southern Tanzania by Francis ‘Rex’ Parrington. Remains are vastly incomplete, but they are claimed to predate any other known dinosaur.
GERMAN: Nyasasaurus-Fossilien am See Nyasa in Süd-Tansania von Francis 'Rex' Parrington entdeckt. Die Überreste sind sehr unvollständig, sollen aber älter als alle anderen bekannten Dinosaurier sein.

ENGLISH: Nyasasaurus
GERMAN: Nyasasaurus

ENGLISH: Editorial: why it is right and proper to hate anti-legitimists-providence itself demands it! Why, these ne’er-do-wells would have the peasant rabble govern themselves (see page 10)
GERMAN: Redaktionelles: warum es richtig und angemessen ist, Anti-Legitimisten zu hassen – die Weitsicht verlangt es!Tunichtgute würden Bauerngesindel sich selbst regieren lassen (weiter auf S. 10)

ENGLISH: Editorial: why it is right to hate the poor-your own rational self-interest demands it! Why, these parasitic gutter people choose to be poor. Show pity to them at your peril. (see page 10)
GERMAN: Redaktionelles: warum es richtig ist, die Armen zu hassen – der rationale Egoismus verlangt es! Dieser parasitäre Abschaum hat die Armut gewählt. Mitleid auf eigenes Risiko. (mehr auf S. 10)

ENGLISH: Editorial: why it is right to hate republicans-stability demands it! Why, without a figurehead to smile benevolently upon us, intrigue and the guillotine will destroy us all (page 10)
GERMAN: Redaktionelles: warum es richtig ist, Republikaner zu hassen – Stabilität verlangt es! Ohne gütig auf uns herablächelnden Repräsentanten werden Intrigen und Guillotine unser Ende sein (S. 10)

ENGLISH: Editorial: why it is right to hate revolutionaries of every stripe-because they cannot be bribed! Why, men of such zeal and rigid doctrinism show no respect for the rule of law (pg. 10)
GERMAN: Redaktionelles: warum es richtig ist, Revolutionäre aller Couleur zu hassen – sie sund unbestechlich! Männer mit solchem Eifer und starren Doktrinen haben keinerlei Respekt vor Gesetz (S. 10)

ENGLISH: Editorial: why it is right to hate the parasites-the party demands it! Why, even the lowliest village baker is an exploiter of the masses. Eradicating the rich will free us all (see page 10)
GERMAN: Redaktionelles: warum es richtig ist, Parasiten zu hassen – die Partei verlangt es! Selbst kleinster Dorfbäcker nutzt Massen aus. Die Reichen auszumerzen, wird uns befreien (mehr auf S. 10).

ENGLISH: Editorial: why it is right to hate subversives-the President demands it! Why, these criminals only yesterday crudely vandalised a marble statue of his Excellency in the capital (see page 10)
GERMAN: Redaktionelles: warum es richtig ist, Staatsfeinde zu hassen – Präsident verlangt es! Erst gestern haben diese Kriminellen Statue Seiner Exzellenz in Hauptstadt schändlich vandalisiert (S. 10)

ENGLISH: Editorial: why it is right to hate the parasites-the party demands it! Why, even the lowliest village baker is an exploiter of the masses. Eradicating the rich will free us all (see page 10)
GERMAN: Redaktionelles: warum es richtig ist, Parasiten zu hassen – die Partei verlangt es! Selbst kleinster Dorfbäcker nutzt Massen aus. Die Reichen auszumerzen, wird uns befreien (mehr auf S. 10).

ENGLISH: Editorial: why it is right to hate reformists of every stripe-the natural order demands it! Why, these liberal speculators and cosmopolitans would run our nation as a whorehouse (see page 10)
GERMAN: Redaktionelles: warum es richtig ist, Reformisten aller Couleur zu hassen – die Natur gebietet es! Liberale Spekulanten und Kosmopoliten würden unsere Nation wie Bordell führen (mehr auf S. 10)

ENGLISH: Following the ‘Imperial Durbar’ in Delhi, the royal proclamation announcing Queen Victoria’s assumption of the title of ‘Empress of India’ was read at the foot of the column in Trafalgar Square. India hasn’t had a crowned ruler since the last Mughal Emperor was deposed by the British East India Company. Following the dissolution of the Company, opinions were expressed that the Queen’s superiority over the many Indian princes should be confirmed by the assumption of the imperial title. Prime Minister Benjamin Disraeli is credited as the architect of the idea.
GERMAN: Nach der "kaiserlichen Durbar" in Delhi wurde am Fuße der Säule auf dem Trafalgar Square die königliche Proklamation verkündet, dass Königin Victoria den Titel "Kaisierin von Indien" erhaltet. Indien besitzte keinen gekrönten Herrscher, seit die British East India Company den letzten Mughal Kaiser absetzte. Nach der Auflösung der Gesellschaft wurden Meinungen geäußert, dass die Überlegenheit der Königin über die vielen indischen Fürsten durch die Annahme des kaiserlichen Titel bestätigt werden sollte. Premierminister Benjamin Disraeli ist diese Idee zuzuschreiben.

ENGLISH: Following the ‘Imperial Durbar’ in Delhi, the royal proclamation announcing Queen Victoria’s assumption of the title of ‘Empress of India’ was read in Trafalgar Square. The imperial title confirms the Queen’s superiority over the many princes of India.
GERMAN: Nach der "kaiserlichen Durbar" in Delhi wurde am Fuße der Säule auf dem Trafalgar Square die königliche Proklamation verkündet, dass Königin Victoria den Titel "Kaisierin von Indien" erhaltet. Der imperiale Tital bestätigt der Königin Überlegenheit gegenüber den indischen Fürsten.

ENGLISH: Following the official ‘Imperial Durbar’ (assemblage) in Delhi, the royal proclamation announcing Queen Victoria’s assumption of the title of ‘Empress of India’ was read in Trafalgar Square.
GERMAN: Nach der "kaiserlichen Durbar" in Delhi wurde am Fuße der Säule auf dem Trafalgar Square die königliche Proklamation verkündet, dass Königin Victoria den Titel "Kaisierin von Indien" erhaltet.

ENGLISH: $COUNTRY$: Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels have published The Communist Manifesto, a short but influential document discussing the history of the society and the class struggle in various countries, which has led to workers in $COUNTRY$ to found a party dedicated to advancing the agenda laid out therein. They call themselves socialists and believe in a land ruled by the workers, where the workers not the bourgeois control the means of production. Equality, justice, solidarity and democracy are other vital points in the socialists’ ideology.
GERMAN: $COUNTRY$: Karl Marx und Friedrich Engels haben das Kommunistische Manifest veröffentlicht, ein knappes aber einflussreiches Dokument über die Geschichte der Gesellschaft und den Klassenkampf in vielen Ländern. Arbeiter in $COUNTRY$ gründeten daraufhin eine Partei mit Zielen des Manifestes. Sie nennen sich Sozialisten und glauben an den Arbeiterstaat, in dem die Arbeiter die Produktion kontrollieren. Gleichheit, Gerechtigkeit, Solidarität und Demokratie sind weitere wichtige Punkte der sozialisitischen Ideologie.

ENGLISH: $COUNTRY$: They call themselves socialists and believe in a land ruled by the workers, where the workers not the bourgeois control the means of production. Equality, justice, solidarity and democracy are other vital points in the socialists’ ideology.
GERMAN: $COUNTRY$: Sie nennen sich Sozialisten und glauben an den Arbeiterstaat, in dem die Arbeiter die Produktion kontrollieren. Gleichheit, Gerechtigkeit, Solidarität und Demokratie sind weitere wichtige Punkte der sozialisitischen Ideologie.

ENGLISH: $COUNTRY$: They are called socialists and believe in a land where workers control means of production. Equality, justice, solidarity and democracy are vital points of their ideology.
GERMAN: $COUNTRY$: Sozialisten glauben an ein Land, in dem die Arbeiter die Produktion kontrollieren. Gleichheit, Gerechtigkeit, Solidarität und Demokratie sind wichtige Punkte ihrer Ideologie.

ENGLISH: $COUNTRY$: We want, no, we NEED a free society, where no one is considered to be superior, no one is left behind and where mankind is free from oppression and scarcity. We need a society without a government, without class divisions and where the workers control the means of production. We postulate a society without division and alienation, a society without money and private property, promising overabundance of resources in the world organized according to our ideology. Distribution ought to be based on need, human association should be completely free.
GERMAN: $COUNTRY$: Wir wollen, nein, wir BRAUCHEN eine freie Gesellschaft, in der niemand den Vorrang hat oder das Nachsehen und in der keine Unterdrückung oder Knappheit herrscht. Wir brauchen eine Gesellschaft ohne Regierung oder Klassentrennung, in der die Arbeiter die Produktion kontrollieren. Wir streben nach einer Gesellschaft ohne Verfremdung, Geld oder Privateigentum mit einem Überschuss an Ressourcen in der Welt gemäß unserer Ideologie. Güterverteilung sollte auf Bedarf basieren, der Mensch komplett frei sein.

ENGLISH: $COUNTRY$: We want, no, we NEED a free society, where no one is considered to be superior, no one is left behind and where mankind is free from scarcity. We need a society without a government, without class divisions and where the workers control the means of production.
GERMAN: $COUNTRY$: Wir wollen, nein, wir BRAUCHEN eine freie Gesellschaft, in der niemand den Vorrang hat oder das Nachsehen und in der keine Knappheit herrscht. Wir brauchen eine Gesellschaft ohne Regierung oder Klassentrennung, in der die Arbeiter die Produktion kontrollieren.

ENGLISH: $COUNTRY$: We want, no, we NEED a free society, where no one is considered to be superior, no one is left behind and where mankind is free from oppression and scarcity.
GERMAN: $COUNTRY$: Wir wollen, nein, wir BRAUCHEN eine freie Gesellschaft, in der niemand den Vorrang hat oder das Nachsehen und in der die Menschheit frei von Unterdrückung und Knappheit ist.

ENGLISH: A group of liberals disgruntled with their lack of economic freedom, and the pace of parliamentary reform, have formed a new faction in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ politics. The Radicals are the revolutionary avantgarde of the liberal ideology, and they will not hesitate to use whatever means necessary to see their ideas of freedom and free trade instituted both in $COUNTRY$ and abroad. They demand a world without state compulsion with perfect individual sovereignty in a free market society organized around the principle of non-aggression.
GERMAN: Eine Gruppe Liberaler, unzufrieden mit ihrem Mangel an wirtschaftlicher Freiheit und parlamentarischen Reformen, hat eine neue Partei in der $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Politik gegründet. Die Radicalen sind die revolutionäre Avantgarde der liberalen Ideologie und werden ohne Zögern alles tun, um ihre Ideen der Freiheit und des freien Handels in $COUNTRY$ und weltweit durchzusetzen. Sie streben nach einer Welt ohne Staatszwang, mit individueller Souveränität und freiem Handel ohne Agression.

ENGLISH: A group of liberals disgruntled with their lack of economic freedom, and the pace of parliamentary reform, have formed a new faction in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ politics. The Radicals are the revolutionary avantgarde of the liberal ideology.
GERMAN: Eine Gruppe Liberaler, unzufrieden mit ihrem Mangel an wirtschaftlicher Freiheit und parlamentarischen Reformen, hat eine neue Partei in der $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Politik gegründet. Die Radicalen sind die revolutionäre Avantgarde der liberalen Ideologie.

ENGLISH: A group of liberals disgruntled with their lack of economic freedom, and the pace of parliamentary reform, have formed a new Radical faction in $COUNTRY_ADJ$ politics.
GERMAN: Eine Gruppe Liberaler, unzufrieden mit ihrem Mangel an wirtschaftlicher Freiheit und parlamentarischen Reformen, hat die radicale Partei in der $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Politik gegründet.

ENGLISH: $COUNTRY$: ‘Strength through Unity! The government has grown weak, we need a party who can unite us, who can give us a strong national identity and who will not be fooled by capitalism’s sweet but poisonous voice’. The Third Way, or fascists as they might be called, are looking to get a seat in the Upper House. They claim state control must be expanded over the vital industries to ensure self-sufficiency and economic independence of the nation. Strongly opposed to all other ideologies, they don’t hesitate to resort to use of violence to grow their power.
GERMAN: $COUNTRY$: 'Stärke durch Einheit! Die Regierung ist schwach, wir brauchen eine Partei, die uns eint, uns eine nationale Identität geben kann und nicht auf die vergifteten Versprechen der Kapitalisten hört.' Der dritte Weg, auch Faschisten genannt, strebt nach einem Sitz im Oberhaus. Sie fordern die Ausweitung der Staatskontrolle auf wichtige Industrien, um die Versorgung und wirtschaftliche Unabhängigkeit der Nation zu sichern. Sie lehnen andere Ideologien ab und schrecken auch nicht vor Gewalt zurück, um ihre Ziele durchzusetzen.

ENGLISH: $COUNTRY$: ‘The government has grown weak, we need a party to unite us, to give us a strong national identity and who will not be fooled by capitalism’s sweet but poisonous voice’. The Third Way, or fascists as they might be called, are looking to get a seat in the Upper House.
GERMAN: $COUNTRY$: 'Die Regierung ist schwach, wir brauchen eine Partei, die uns eint, uns eine nationale Identität gibt und nicht auf die vergifteten Versprechen der Kapitalisten hört.' Der dritte Weg, auch Faschisten genannt, strebt nach einem Sitz im Oberhaus.

ENGLISH: $COUNTRY$: The Third Way, or fascists as they are called, are looking to get a seat in the Upper House. Strongly opposed to all other ideologies, they don’t hesitate to resort to violence.
GERMAN: $COUNTRY$:Der dritte Weg, auch Faschisten genannt, strebt nach einem Sitz im Oberhaus. Sie lehnen andere Ideologien ab und schrecken auch nicht vor Gewalt zurück.

ENGLISH: Troublesome reports arrive from Ireland of what appears to be a widespread shortage in agricultural products gripping the territory and establishing a situation of famine among the population. While reports vary as to the severity of the situation, tales of entire harvests of potato being rendered useless by the potato blight illness set the stage for what some are dubbing ‘the beginning of a calamity’ due to the tuber’s importance in the Irish diet. $COUNTRY$ response to the reports has so far been indecisive, and many wonders how the situation will evolve.

Reports arrive from Ireland of a shortage in agricultural products establishing a famine in the island, with tales of entire harvests of potato being rendered useless. $COUNTRY$ response to the reports has so far been indecisive as many wonder how the situation will evolve.
Reports come from Ireland of a shortage in agricultural products causing a famine in the island. With tales of entire harvests rendered useless, many call on the government to take action.

Tensions came to a boil in the village of Ballingary in Ireland as the famine affecting the region reaches catastrophic proportions. A group calling themselves the ‘Young Irelanders’ rose in rebellion against the British authorities, raising barricades and facing the police in a standoff that lasted several hours before police reinforcements lead the rebels to flee. As the manhunt for the rebel leaders continue, many are believed to have escaped to France and USA. The British government has dubbed the rebellion as ‘an outrageous attempt to subvert law and order’.

Tensions came to a boil in the village of Ballingary in Ireland where a group called the ‘Young Irelanders’ rose in rebellion against British authorities, facing the police in a standoff that lasted several hours before police reinforcements forced the rebels to flee.
In Ireland, a group called the ‘Young Irelanders’ rose against the British authorities, facing the police in a standoff before police reinforcements forced the rebels to flee.

The tone among the people in Ireland has changed. Many Irish nationalist who emigrated to the United States founded a militant organization called the Fenian Brotherhood there, a group dedicated to freeing Ireland from British control… and now they have formed a sister organization back home, the Irish Republican Brotherhood. Already they are stirring up trouble, and it seems certain they will continue until some manner of home rule is attained.

Many Irish nationalist who emigrated to the United States founded a militant organization called the Fenian Brotherhood there, a group dedicated to freeing Ireland from British control… and now they have formed a sister organization back home, the Irish Republican Brotherhood.
Irish nationalists who immigrated to the United States founded the radical Fenian Brotherhood. Now they have formed a sister organization back home: the Irish Republican Brotherhood.

Spurred on by increased public sympathy towards the Irish Republican Brotherhood following the Easter Rising, the Sinn Féin have won a majority of seats in Ireland during the last election. They have gathered in Dublin and declared themselves Dáil Éireann, the parliament of Ireland, and demanded that Ireland be granted immediate full independence. Considering their popularity, refusing would all but certainly trigger a war… but many agree that this is not the way to a peaceful resolution, and that $COUNTRY$ should never submit to such demands.

The Sinn Féin have won a majority of seats in Ireland during the last election. They gathered in Dublin and declared themselves the parliament, and demanded that Ireland be granted immediate independence. Considering their popularity, refusing would all but certainly trigger a war.
The Sinn Féin have won a majority of seats in Ireland during the last election. They gathered in Dublin and demanded that Ireland be granted immediate independence.

With Ireland once again under British control, talks have begun in earnest to deal with the Irish situation once and for all… now on British terms, rather than on theirs. The suggestion is that Ireland remain an autonomous Dominion under British control, with any regions that wish to opt out of the new state and remain part of $COUNTRY$ able to do so. Others suggest this is unworkable, and the British should either simply release them and keep them as allies or annex them entirely.
With Ireland once again under British control, talks have begun in earnest to deal with the Irish situation once and for all… now on British terms, rather than on Ireland’s.
With Ireland once again under British control, talks have begun in earnest to deal with the Irish situation once and for all… now on British terms, rather than on Ireland’s.

Charles Stewart Parnell has been successfully advancing his Irish Home Rule Bill through the British Parliament, and while it is continually being held up by opposition from the Upper House, there is a sense that the man is managing to convince $COUNTRY_ADJ$ law-makers who-in the not-too-distant past-might have said that Home Rule was unthinkable.

Charles Stewart Parnell has been successfully advancing his Irish Home Rule Bill through the British Parliament. There is a sense that the man is managing to convince $COUNTRY_ADJ$ law-makers who-in the not-too-distant past-might have said that Home Rule was unthinkable.
Charles Stewart Parnell has been successfully advancing his Irish Home Rule Bill through British Parliament. The man is convincing law-makers who might have once deemed Home Rule unthinkable.

$COUNTRY$: A massive demonstration by the Chartists has taken place in Kennington Common, with liberals demanding that the People’s Charter be implemented immediately-giving equal votes to all men, rich or poor, as well as secret ballots and a fair distribution of constituencies. Many in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government suggest that such public gatherings should be made illegal, and that at best the British government should make empty promises to these rabble-rousers. Others fear that refusing their demands will lead to the monarchy being toppled by rebellion.

$COUNTRY$: A massive demonstration by the Chartists has taken place in Kennington Common, with liberals demanding that the People’s Charter be implemented immediately-giving equal votes to all men, as well as secret ballots and a fair distribution of constituencies.
$COUNTRY$: A massive demonstration by the Chartists has taken place in Kennington Common, with liberals demanding that the People’s Charter be implemented immediately.

The Hungarian Diet has grown increasingly independent of Austrian rule in recent years. Field Marshall Count Franz Philipp von Lamberg was sent to Hungary to take personal control over their armies, but was attacked upon his arrival. In response, the Austrian government ordered the Hungarian Diet dissolved and the Ban of Croatia installed in Lamberg’s place. The Hungarians have refused to obey, and thus $COUNTRY$ now faces civil war to maintain the integrity of the empire.

The Hungarian Diet has grown increasingly independent of Austrian rule. Field Marshall Count von Lamberg was sent to Hungary to take control over their armies. The Hungarians refused to obey, and thus $COUNTRY$ now faces civil war to maintain the integrity of the empire.
The Hungarians refused to obey and order from the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to surrender control of their armies, and thus $COUNTRY$ now faces civil war to maintain the integrity of the empire.

$COUNTRY$: With the entire nation ready to overthrow the monarchy, ministers have approached the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ King with advice on reforming the constitution before it’s too late. Including provisions that permitted the direct election of the lower house as well as numerous freedoms the Dutch do not already enjoy might pacify the liberals, they say, and thus prevent $COUNTRY$ from the unpleasant prospect of $CAPITAL$ being overtaken by rebels.

$COUNTRY$: With the entire nation ready to overthrow the monarchy, ministers have approached the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ King with advice on reforming the constitution with more liberal concessions before it’s too late.
$COUNTRY$: With the entire nation ready to overthrow the monarchy, ministers have approached the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ King with advice on reforming the constitution before it’s too late.

With the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people seemingly ready to break down the government’s doors, demanding constitutional reform, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Kaiser has pondered the wisdom in perhaps giving it to them. Some moderate reforms, allowing the masses their vote but retaining ultimate power for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aristocracy and the Kaiser, should please them enough to dispel this rabble… or so he appears to assume.

With the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people seemingly ready to break down the government’s doors, demanding constitutional reform, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Kaiser has pondered the wisdom in perhaps giving them at least some moderate freedoms to appease them.
With the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people demanding constitutional reform, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Kaiser has pondered the wisdom in perhaps giving them at least some moderate freedoms to appease them.

The unrest in France hit its height recently, with crowds streaming through the streets of Paris and erecting barricades. In what was widely regarded as an accident, a French guardsman fired his musket on the citizens and set off a massacre. The resulting conflagration swept the city, with crowds chanting ‘Long live the Reform!’ and ‘Down with the King!’. Despite assurances that everything is under control, the king has abdicated and fled the country… leaving a provisional government to step in and declare the Second Republic.

The unrest in France hit its height recently, with crowds streaming through the streets of Paris and erecting barricades. Despite assurances that everything is under control, the king abdicated and fled the country… leaving a provisional government to declare the Second Republic.
After months of unrest sweeping through Paris, the King of France abdicated and fled the country… leaving a provisional government to declare the Second Republic.

Unable to force the Upper House to repeal its prohibition against presidential re-election and facing removal from power, the popular Louis-Napoleon has overthrown the French government. He has been christened Napoléon III, regaining his uncle’s throne as the Emperor of France.
The popular Louis-Napoleon has overthrown the French government and been christened Napoléon III, regaining his uncle’s throne as the Emperor of France.

The popularity of Louis-Napoleon has waned. Where once it was expected that his ascension would return France to the greatness it experienced during the reign of his uncle, instead France sees itself being eclipsed by its neighbours. The Emperor has cultivated many enemies among the liberals in Paris, and now they have chosen their moment to strike. Napoleon has been deposed, and the only question remains as to what form France shall now take.

The popularity of Louis-Napoleon has waned. The Emperor has cultivated many enemies among the liberals in Paris, and now they have chosen their moment to strike. Napoleon has been deposed, and the only question remains as to what form France shall now take.
Emperor Napoleon III of France has been deposed by his enemies in Paris, and the only question remains as to what form the French government shall now take.

Louis-Napoleon has grown ill in recent months, slowly surrendering more and more ground to the Upper House. Thus, his death comes with no surprise to many. Mourned by the entire nation, and by his beloved Empress Eugénie, the question now turns to who will follow him.
The death of Napoleon III comes with no surprise to many. Mourned by the entire nation, and by his beloved Empress Eugénie, the question now turns to who will follow him.

Iran, the cradle of civilization—the chickens appear to have come home to roost today as members of diplomatic circles are in general agreement that the nation of Persia can be counted among the great powers of the world. Since coming into contact with western influences years ago, the industrious people of Persia have made sweeping advances in the fields of culture, industry and military prowess and can no longer be dismissed as backward savages. Geopolitical experts have expressed concerns that the new Persia could attempt expansion through Asia and beyond.

Diplomatic circles are in agreement that Persia can be counted among the great powers of the world. The industrious Persian people have made sweeping advances in the fields of culture, industry and military and can now no longer be dismissed as filthy, backward savages.
Diplomatic circles now agree that Persia can be counted among the great powers of the world. The Persian people have made sweeping advances and can no longer be dismissed as backward savages.
The Peacock Throne

A new era for the Orient begins with the recent success of the Constitutionalists in Persia. After months of strikes, protests and even some armed insurrections, the rebels have finally put enough pressure on the leadership that they cracked. The new ‘Majiles’—the Parliament—worked hard, pushing negotiations on many issues against the central authority. Their fight ends now with the establishment of the so-called ‘Constitution of $YEAR$’. Greats Powers of the world welcome the country’s effort while remaining wary of any possible instability it could generate in the region.

After months of strikes, protests and even some armed insurrections, the rebels have finally put enough pressure on the leadership that they cracked. The new ‘Majiles’—the Parliament—worked hard, pushing negotiations on many issues against the central authority. Their fight ends now with the establishment of the so-called ‘Constitution of $YEAR$’.
The new ‘Majiles’—the Parliament—worked hard, pushing negotiations on many issues against the central authority. Their fight ends now with the establishment of the so-called ‘Constitution of $YEAR$.

Once again, Mexico is being pulled apart by infighting: when it is not Texas, Yucatan or Rio Grande showing their hostility toward the central administration, it is now the turn of California to oppose the government of Mexico City. Conflict arose amidst immigration issues, land distribution disputes and rising tensions with the US. Mexican officials, afraid of the seemingly endless influx of illegal American immigrants, waved the threat of expulsion in the face of the large land-owners of the region. No more was needed and, shortly after, they declared the unilateral secession of the Republic of California.

Immigration issues and rising tensions with the US are at the heart of Mexico’s latest rebellion. When the central government threatened expulsion from the territory, California’s wealthy American immigrants decide to have none of it and declared unilateral secession, flying high the Grizzly Bear flag of the new republic.
Tension with the US in on the rise again in Mexico where immigration disputes between California’s immigrants and the central government motivated the former to secede from the latter.
The Bear Flag Revolt

A troubled man known under the alias ‘Jack the Ripper’ is committing serial murders in the London area. Targeting women from the poor parts of the city, the degenerate uses a gruesome, inhuman modus operandi, cutting their throats prior to abdominal mutilations. George Lusk of the Whitechapel Vigilance Committee received a letter titled ‘From Hell’ which included half of a preserved human kidney, purportedly taken from one of the victims. People are pressing Scotland Yard to answer questions and find the criminal. The government has, for the moment, made no comment on the issue.

A troubled man known under the alias ‘Jack the Ripper’ is committing serial murders in the London area. Targeting women from the poor parts of the city, the degenerate uses a gruesome, inhuman modus operandi, cutting their throats prior to abdominal mutilations. People are pressing Scotland Yard to answer questions and find the criminal. The government has, for the moment, made no comment on the issue.
A troubled man known under the alias ‘Jack the Ripper’ is committing serial murders in the London area. The government has, for the moment, made no comment on the issue.

$COUNTRY$: In a surprise election win’, the fascists have taken power in the government. Technically they are allowed to do so, as their party has not been banned. There are concerns’, however, that their ultimate goal is to take over $COUNTRY$ and that this election win is just the first step in doing so. Regardless, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ people have spoken… and the monarchy must now decide whether to intervene and refuse the fascists their mandate or admit that they have no power and thus relinquishing all control over the government.

Thus, a political showdown has resulted: the communists cannot be permitted to form the new government, but even if the monarchy refuses them the next election might simply have the same crisis occur all over again, or worse. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ monarchy is reportedly weighing its options-invalidating the election entirely or casting aside the voting reforms and restoring its absolute rule.

The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ monarchy is reportedly weighing its options-invalidating the election entirely or casting aside the voting reforms and restoring its absolute rule.

$COUNTRY$:The streets have turned into rivers of people in $COUNTRY$’s $CAPITAL$, where every man, woman and child seems to have come out of the woodwork, and into the streets, to participate in a massive street protest directed directly against the monarch. The issue on the table is the appointed, unconstitutional government, and the masses are calling on the monarch to respect the election results.

Lt. Colonel George Armstrong Custer reports back from the Black Hills with an announcement that gold in substantial quantities has been discovered in the Dakota territory. Prospectors, miners and fortune-seekers flock to the area making it into the most populated part of the entire state. Railroads are being constructed to deliver prospectors to newly established towns and camps in formerly desolate area. But troubling reports tell of strange howls and cries coming from the hills at night. Some say that the Sioux are going on the warpath…
GERMAN: Lt. Colonel George Armstong Custer kehrt mit Meldungen von reichen Goldfunden in Dakota von den Black Hills zurück. Goldsucher aller Art strömen in das Gebiet und machen es zum meistbevölkerten im ganzen Staat. Eisenbahnstrecken werden gebaut, um Goldsucher in neu errichtete Städte und Lager in der einstmalige Einöde zu bringen. Verstörende Meldungen berichten jedoch von seltsamem Geheul und Rufen in der Nacht aus den Hügeln. Manche sagen, dass die Sioux sich auf dem Kriegspfad befinden…

ENGLISH: Lt. Colonel Custer reports back from the Black Hills with an announcement that gold has been discovered in the Dakota territory. But troubling reports tell of strange howls and cries coming from the hills at night. Some say that the Sioux are going on the warpath…
GERMAN: Lt. Colonel George Armstong Custer kehrt mit Meldungen von reichen Goldfunden in Dakota von den Black Hills zurück. Verstörende Meldungen berichten jedoch von seltsamem Geheul und Rufen in der Nacht aus den Hügeln. Manche sagen, dass die Sioux sich auf dem Kriegspfad befinden…

ENGLISH: Lt. Colonel Custer reports back from the Black Hills with an announcement that gold has been discovered in the Dakota territory. But some say that the Sioux are going on the warpath…
